page.title: 04WOOLHOPE LANDSCAPE (3)
page.content: {Buildings } The centre of Woolhope is old but there is a fair amount of new housing. An unusual feature of the village is that there are walls everywhere and very few hedges. There are several old farmhouses in the surrounding area some dating back 600 years. Farmhouses worth visiting for their architectural interest are Croose, Yayers, Court & Hyde farms and Terrace Hall which have black & white half-timbering. Wessington Court, on site of earlier manor, is surrounded by beautiful parkland with arboretum & has been a wartime hospital and more recently a school for handicapped & deaf children. It is now being converted into flats. The Post Office & village shop is in an old cottage, & serves light refreshments.
